destinations.name: The Corvallis Advocate Loft
destinations.summary: Group show.  Installation and photography from Shar Fagersten, surrealist Cyrus Peery, mathematic art from Jeremy Smith, pop works from Tim Blackburn, metallurgic pieces from Tony Fisher, and more. Treats too.
destinations.description: Ranging from an examination of marriage and society to surrealism and pop, this group show brings together many walks of life and, mixed material.  Installation and photography from Shar Fagersten,  surrealist painting and sculpture by Cyrus Peery, mathematic flat pieces and origami from Jeremy Smith, urban pop stencil and spray paint by Tim Blackburn, metallurgic landscape pieces from Tony Fisher, and more. Treats too.

destinations.name: Art in the Valley
destinations.summary: This year round art co-operative shows the work of many local artists.  “Landscapes from La La Land” by Beatrice Rubenfeld is the feature show in October. Refreshments add to the fun for CAW.
destinations.description:
Art in the Valley is the oldest artist run co-operative in Corvallis.  A wide assortment of artwork is displayed in a welcoming little shop.  Refreshments will be served from 4-8 during the CAW event.

Beatrice Rubenfeld is featured artist for the month of October with “Landscapes from La La Land”, an exhibit of oil paintings varying from plein air to imaginary.

destinations.name: ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
destinations.summary: colors made in heaven. Roxanna Hendricks. mixed media works
destinations.description: colors made in heaven. Roxanna Hendricks. mixed media works. 541-224-6503, ceiworks.org

destinations.name: Azure Fine Art Gallery
destinations.summary: Join us in September and explore the boundless exploration of the universe with Stacy Spangler’s collage, where dreams find their way into the waking world.  Then follow us into the ocean depths in Rinee Merritt’s glass coral in the birdcage.

destinations.name: Kaleidoscope Studios
destinations.summary: Copper Autumn. Copper is our September focus and our featured jewelry artist is Jeanmarie Denning of Blessing Stones. Her Fall designs incorporate stone & organic elements.
destinations.description:
Copper Autumn

We are ready for Autumn!  For the September Art Walk and beyond, we will highlight warm, earthy copper and jewelry in Autumn organic colors.  Our featured local jewelry artist is Jeanmarie Denning of Blessing Stones. Her Fall designs incorporate stone and organic elements, often complemented with copper or antique brass.

Fall favorite snacks, *free* bracelet project and a copper component sale round out the evening!

destinations.name: Cyrano's
destinations.summary: Susan Stogsdill has been revisiting the past with childhood books, turning them into journals.  Come see if your favorite book might be among the stacks!

destinations.name: Brittney West
destinations.summary: Come see thought-provoking activist art promoting a more compassionate coexistence, browse through older work and Eco-Prints for sale!
destinations.description: Come view over a decade of Brittney West's oil paintings and mixed-media drawings as well as view her recent activist artwork, exhibiting thought-provoking imagery intended to create a more compassionate coexistence. Enjoy snacks and wine in her ambient studio, pick at the artist's brain and snoop around. All are welcome!

destinations.name: Pegasus & Old World Deli
destinations.summary:
"Safe Places to Fall" will host paintings of Willamette Valley by artists Margret Hay and William Shumway and several other local image makers.

Mixed media pieces by artists Jim Noel, Bill Shumway and Jennifer Bennett will be on display along with metal sculptures by Raymond Hunter

destinations.name: Studio262
destinations.summary: Jennifer Lommers & Carrie Tasman unveil their new Collaborative Paintings. Artists reception, 4-8pm. Meet the artists and see this exciting new project.
destinations.description:
Botanical Abstracts: Collaborative Works by Carrie Tasman & Jennifer Lommers

Please join us for our artist reception, 4-8pm, where Carrie & Jennifer will unveil their latest project, creating paintings together. Enjoy their attention to color and design as their styles overlap in new and exciting ways.

destinations.name: Studio Beatrice
destinations.summary: Studio Beatrice hosts “Injeanious Silks” hand painted silk wall hangings and scarves by Jean Lawrence.  Refreshments, Music.
destinations.description: “Injeanious Silks”, the September feature show at Studio Beatrice features Jean Lawrence presenting arange of hand painted silk wall hangings and scarves.  Vibrant colors and diverse motifs embellish precious silk fabric.  Refreshments and guitar music by Marshall Adams and add to the festivities at 230 NW 6th Street from 4-8 PM.

destinations.name: The Arts Center
destinations.summary: The Arts Center features Contemporary Art Quilts by Bonnie Bucknam and Linda McLaughlin, as part of Quilt County.
destinations.description:
The Arts Center features Contemporary Art Quilts by Bonnie Bucknam and Linda McLaughlin, as part of Quilt County.

Bucknam’s quilts are abstract interpretation of landscape and trees; McLaughlin concentrates in the meditative power of the circle.

destinations.name: Majestic Theatre
destinations.summary: LOLZ: Instances of Humor in Art, a themed community art show! LOLZ celebrates the relationship of comedy and creativity – highlighting how local artists incorporate humor in visual art.
destinations.description: LOLZ: Instances of Humor in Art is the first of a series of themed community art shows slated for the Majestic Theatre in the coming year. Our objective is to celebrate and explore the relationship when comic meets creativity, and highlight the unique viewpoints of our local artists and how they choose to incorporate humor in visual art. Whether it’s exuberant, smile-inducing slapstick comic strips or bold and snarky insults shouted by Shakespeare’s tragic heroes, there’s no question of the importance of the presence of comedy in art throughout the ages, reminding us of the absurdity of sanity and that if all else fails, laughter is the best medicine.

destinations.name: Fairbanks Art Gallery
destinations.summary: This exhibit has a broad diversity of approaches to the making of art, with faculty working in photography, painting, drawing, mixed media, printmaking and video.
